pros: Get to help students, and you get good review with all the nursing content.

review_title: Great colleagues but things have changed...
pros: The work/life balance is wonderful. The hours are 8:00 - 4:30 M-TH and 8:00-3:00 on F. PDO is acquired weekly but even if you don't have the hours, if something comes up, most bosses are understanding. Work colleagues are pleasant.
cons: AHU is in a transitional period. In the past few years we have become a part of Corporate which has its ups and downs. In the past year we have had several employees quit or retire and their positions are either taking some time to fill or are not being filled at all which leaves more responsibilities on people who did not sign up for them.

job_title: Student Library Worker in Orlando, FL
cons: There are no type of cons to report on

job_title: Student Services Representative in Orlando, FL
pros: Flexible schedule, part time opportunities, faith based organization.
cons: Pay is not as competitive as other part-time employers.

pros: AdventHealth has great faculty who care about their job. You will be surrounded by some of the nicest people in the business.
cons: Company leadership is stuck between a rock and a hard place. They want to grow students into critical thinkers who are strong candidates for competitive medical schools. While students want this education in theory, in practice many feel it is much work and get upset with poor grades. Unfortunately, the administration would rather have happy students passing classes and getting token preparation.

pros: AHU is a wonderful place to work! Great people, great community, great opportunities.
cons: The pay is a little below the industry standard

review_title: Overall positive experience, room for improvement
pros:
-Lush, green university campus with many outdoor spaces
-Team environment was a plus
-Kind co-workers, wonderful to work with
-Worked with my class schedule
cons:
-Student workers are excluded from company-wide team building seminars. It would have been nice to be included at least for some of them or have team building functions of our own.
-Giving certain full-time employees a high amount of additional responsibilities compromised the efficiency and effectiveness of certain systems.

pros: All employees treat you like family. The president is so nice and is a great leader, for him everyone is important in the organization.
cons: Some managers do not know how to distribute the work among their substitutes and do not act with leadership. The work is so overwhelming. Although the compensation is good, the work never stops, it is necessary to work with too many hats. They demand you as if there were several people in the position

pros: The people there are wonderful and are truly there because they love the students, not the low pay.
cons: No room to move up. They do not train for advancement.  The faculty is a different story, but not for staff.

job_title: Director of Online Education in Orlando, FL
pros: great benefits, personal growth and various training opportunities
cons: Local business limiting transfers to other cities and/or states

pros: flexible good people earn well treated well
